titleproper.value:
Guide to the Max M. Kampelman Research Files on Communist Influence in the Labor Movement
                    <num>TAM.310</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T19:21-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Max M. Kampelman Research Files on Communist Influence in the Labor Movement

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
Max M. Kampelman, lawyer, diplomat, and educator, wrote 
                <emph render="italic">The Communist Party vs. The C.I.O: A Study in Power Politics</emph>(1957). Contains clippings, reports, typescripts and notes on Communist influence in the labor movement, with emphasis on New York State, and includes a typescript, 
                <emph render="italic">Sidney Hillman and the Communists..</emph>(45 pp.)

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>The preceding biography appears on the website of the law firm of Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson LLP, where, as of April, 2004, Kampelman, was "of counsel." 
                        <archref>
                            <extref ns2:href="http://www.ffhsj.com/bios/kampema.htm">Website</extref> </archref></item>
                </list>

Contains clippings, reports, typescripts and notes on Communist influence in the labor movement, with emphasis on New York State. Notable items include 
                <emph render="italic">Sidney Hillman and the Communists</emph>(typescript, 45 pp.), 
                <emph render="italic">Report on the NYC Municipal Elections</emph>by Bella Dodd (apparently an FBI transcript of a report at a meeting of the leadership of CPUSA District 2), and 
                <emph render="italic">Saul Mills and the NYC CIO Council</emph>(ts., 3 pp.). Labor unions discussed include the International Fur and Leather Workers Union of the United States and Canada, and the Transport Workers Union of America. Local 100.

subject.value: Labor unions and communism |z New York (State)

corpname.value: Transport Workers Union of America. Local 100.
